Another exciting week at NASA in the books!

The #CRS28 mission delivered cargo to the @Space_Station and @NASA_Astronauts Steve Bowen and @Astro_Woody performed a spacewalk to upgrade the space station’s power supply.

Get all the details: http://nasa.gov/subscribe

Smoke from wildfires in Quebec moved across eastern portions of Canada and the U.S. this week. This @NASAEarth computer model used satellite, aircraft, and ground-based data to track the black carbon particles (soot) and hazardous air. https://go.nasa.gov/3J4yaiu

To-do: Become a NASA Intern 

Today our #NASAInterns completed their first week at @NASA. Already these #ArtemisGeneration interns are putting their talent and creativity to work for the betterment of all. 

Welcome to the team!
.@NASA_Astronauts Stephen Bowen and @Astro_Woody successfully installed and deployed the space station's fifth roll-out solar array during a six-hour and three-minute spacewalk today.

There’s space for everyone this #PrideMonth, and we’re celebrating the LGBTQI+ employees who help us reach for the stars, examine humanity’s place in the universe, and study our home planet: http://go.nasa.gov/3C9ncnU
Live from @LibraryCongress: U.S. Poet Laureate Ada Limón reveals her Poem for Europa, an original work that will fly aboard the @EuropaClipper spacecraft to Jupiter's icy moon.
LIVE: Join NASA and @BoeingSpace officials as we share an update on the first #Starliner Crew Flight Test. Tune in.

@NASA and @BoeingSpace will host a media teleconference at 5pm ET today for an update on Boeing's first crewed flight on the CST-100 Starliner to the @Space_Station.

Listen in: http://nasa.gov/live

LIVE: Experts at @NASA_Johnson are discussing our upcoming spacewalks, scheduled for June 9 and June 15, to set up new solar arrays outside the @Space_Station.

We're taking questions from media and the public—share your spacewalk Qs with #AskNASA.

Hurricane season in the Atlantic begins today. Our unique perspective from space allows us to study storms and their evolution, providing data to support forecasting and disaster responses: https://go.nasa.gov/3fYNZYE

Join us and @LibraryCongress as U.S. Poet Laureate Ada Limón reveals her poem for the @EuropaClipper mission. The poem will be engraved on the spacecraft, and travel 1.8 billion miles (2.89 billion kilometers) to an icy moon of Jupiter. 

Tune in: https://bit.ly/42eJZJO

I just reached a milestone only surpassed by Opportunity: 30 km on Mars   

I've explored so much in my 10-plus-year trek through Gale Crater, but there are many more rocks to sample and analyze! Retrace my tracks with this interactive map: http://go.nasa.gov/3EtmSCi

The diversity of our NASA team is what brings different perspectives to our missions, and we celebrate and share their stories. To protect our people from personal attacks, we have decided to limit comments on this post.

This month and every month, we recognize the achievements and contributions of our Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander workforce.

Check out the gallery and celebrate #AANHPIHeritageMonth with us: https://go.nasa.gov/3MHtxf9

When the Relativity Space Terran 1 rocket lit up the night sky as it launched this past March, it became the first 3D-printed rocket test of its kind. Learn about GRCop—an innovative, high strength material at the center of this breakthrough: https://go.nasa.gov/44igKrA
Solid answers, good job everybody. And as for us? We love exploring, but there's no place like home.

Astronaut Kjell Lindgren has been a crewmember on the @Space_Station for two long-duration stays. His work during those expeditions helps keep crew safe and healthy and directly contributes to our goal of going to Mars. #AANHPIHeritageMonth https://go.nasa.gov/42DHp0r

Our next @SpaceX cargo launch, carrying supplies and a new set of unrolling solar panels to the @Space_Station, is now scheduled to lift off from @NASAKennedy on Saturday, June 3. Media accreditation is open: https://go.nasa.gov/3M5UuKB

Happy #TeacherAppreciationWeek! Our thanks go out to the teachers and educators who work tirelessly to elevate the next generation of explorers.

Join us this week for live webinars and ready-to-use resources from @NASASTEM and @DoNASAScience: https://go.nasa.gov/3NOWmZu

Two storm-observing TROPICS small satellites lifted off on a @RocketLab Electron rocket, with two more to follow this month. This marks the first completed launch for a @NASA_LSP contract designed to increase access to space for science and tech missions. https://go.nasa.gov/44QozFo
